title: Suddenlink and League
body: I've read the past article of the attempted peering with sudden link which was about 8 months ago. Any updates on it?

replies.body: I don't see them listed in our [NA Peering Partners page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/210665503-NA-Peering-Partners), so we're likely still in talks with them about peering. I don't have any more information about this aside from what's posted on that page, but if you're experiencing issues with your connection to League, please let me know.

Here's the thing my friends and I all use sudden link and sometimes the ping would be at a steady 70/ms or so for all of us but the majority of the time the ping would spike to 250/ms throughout entire games which is frustrating to deal with.

It sounds like there may be issues along the route to the server that could be causing latency hikes. We can take a look at your route if you run a traceroute log with [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net). After launching the app, simply plug in the IP address 104.160.131.1 and run it for 5 minutes, then export the results as text and paste them here.

Let me know if you have any questions.

It appears there are not big issues on your route until your connection hits the Telia node at riot-ic-315570-dls-b21.c.telia.net with 265ms of latency. 

Since your ISP partners with Telia to deliver your connection to servers, you'll want to reach out to your ISP's tier 2 support with this traceroute so they can start investigating.

Let me know if you have any additional questions.

Your latency inside your local network is pretty high at 52ms. If you're not on WiFi, this could be an indication that your router/modem is having some configuration or hardware issues. Additionally, your latency is pretty high along your entire route to the server, specifically staying in the 100's along Suddenlink's nodes, then spiking up to 327ms on Telia's network.

Since there are some pretty big issues along Suddelink and Telia's networks, along with some potential issues with your local network, I recommend reaching out to Suddenlink's tier 2 support. If you give them this traceroute, they'll have a lot more context on what's happening and where it's happening at.

Let me know if you have any additional questions.
its says winMTR is for windows 7 and before, what if we have windows 8 or 10
I'm one of the friends of this ned guy, so i can prove his story.
it works for 8 and ten just fine
